description: From Middle English litelnes, litelnesse, from Old English lytelnysse, lȳtelnes, equivalent to little +‎ -ness.

entries.meaning: The property of being little, smallness.
examples: His littleness didn't bother him, except when he needed to get something off the top shelf.
Court, city, church are all shops of smallwares;
All having blown to sparks their noble fire,
And drawn their sound gold ingot into wire;
All trying by a love of littleness
To make abridgments, and to draw to less
Even that nothing which at first we were;
